body: It is an important component for pixel-wise prediction task
Sorry, got it. Then no problem to merge.
Close for now since nobody seems is interested in implementing this feature. Welcome to reopen if have updates.
@hiraditya Could you please make a pull request so that we could review and merge it in?

Current implementation supports group when using mshadow convolution, but not cudnn. You may need to play with the weights a bit in the converter. Close this issue for now, please feel free to reopen it if you meet any problems in converting models.
Close for now. Please feel free to reopen it if needed
i have replaced gcc and g++ with gcc-4.8 and g++-4.8 in config.mk which version is 4.8.5, but the same ld error appears again :(
Do you have several CUDA installed on your machine?

I have checked the codes, and passed several test.
Please have a check and then merge @tqchen
@mli @mavenlin @tqchen
Done! https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/1145

Hi @Gelu74,

I will probably make an example in of original sample today and post it at here.  After you successfully run it, I recommend to try example here: https://github.com/auroraxie/Kaggle-NDSB

Thanks @antinucleon 
Look forward to it, yes the solution by auroraxie was my next step, I am trying to understand the simpler model first.

Hi guys,

Thanks for your answers and effort.  I will re-run the training with the latest code.

## make: **\* [libs] Error 1
Curand normal generators require that the number of outputs be even. 3,1,5,6 would work fine. @tqchen We probably should try to get around this somehow?
use Optimizer.set_lr_scale
symbol.infershape
hah, yes, I didn't notice that CURAND did not do this fix, we can do a patch around @piiswrong to mshadow by rounding more data
@piiswrong Thanks!
still a lot of spacing issues need to be fixed
@antinucleon @phunterlau FYI

Although I don't use R, I think it is similar to Python. You can use `Group` symbol to make multiple output, eg: `out = mx.sym.Group([act2, softmax])`. Then the first output of the network is `act2`, second output is`softmax`
@hetong007

Note that `make clean` will not clean mshadow. I would recommend trying

```
cd mshadow
git pull
make clean
make -j
cd ..
```

Sorry can't edit comment from a phone. 

After pulling and recompiling mshadow you will need to recompile mxnet too.
I train inception-bn again, and the problem has fixed

Ok I don't know what happened: 

I removed python-skimage: 

`sudo apt-get remove python-skimage`

and the I installed miniconda2 and from there I did 

```
conda install opencv 
conda install scikit-image
```

And it is working now
Yeah, it is confirmed everything looks normal this time.  Thank you guys for the great job. Really appreciate it.

Is it the low rank technique for speed up, e.g. neural art?

---

Oops, I asked this dumb question before reading the readme change. Sorry. It looks nice and I am going to try with neural art.
Please merge two PR: https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/1162 https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/pull/1157
you can fix the RMSE metric (not your input y_train) by reshaping the label or prediction.
I did end up reshaping the values in the RMSE metric.
You can do either, depending on your use case.
I am also talking to an iOS expert and see if he can help making a demo like Whatsthis. Hope it works.
Close for now. Welcome to PR when you get it work.
OK
@mli

that will be very nice! two kinds of results will be interesting, 
1. scalability numbers, such as the performance numbers
2. the convergence results. 

why not you first write down your results on a documents, such as google doc, then we can have a a discussion how to put the numbers there.

it looks like cudnn 3 may have bugs which affect the convergence. also you may need to use the new updater to get to correct results, which is probably related to your issue #1144 @antinucleon @winstywang have the newest progress info.
The latest codes should fix the val accuracy drop issue.
The allocation happens at Resource.Get which calls TensorContainer.Resize to allocate the memory
https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet/blob/master/include/mxnet/resource.h#L89
Got it, thanks.

_WARNING: The data being saved is truncated to 1024 characters._

You have a really long PATH... Try to trim it down a little bit. For
example, you can safely get rid of the SQL server related PATH.

My current (dirty) workaround is:

   train_y1  <<-    target_data_frame[ ,   "y" ]
   sysnoise <<- seq(.000001,.000001 \* length(train_y1), by = .000001) 
   train_y  <<-   train_y1 + sysnoise

And then 

demo.metric.myrange <- mx.metric.custom("range", function(label, pred) { 

  i_train_row <- round( (label \* 1000000 - as.integer(label) \* 1000000), 0  ) 

  ...

}

It worked but seems too ad-hoc and might not work for far longer rows.
And the initial predict values look slightly biased towards the noised values...
Looks good to me.

How is this different from OneHotEncoding?
Also you don't need three arguments for this, use ret as lhs instead.

It can be seen as a generalized version of onehot_encoding
This operator does something like `new_arr = arr.copy(); new_arr[np.arange(shape[0]), indices] = val`. When arr is zero matrix and val is one vector, it becomes onehot_encoding.

Was due to DMLC's S3 module did not yet handles Temp Redirect, whichi need to be fixed.

build mxnet under centos have a little complex, i spend several days to resolve this issue...however, i success last....
my os is centos 5.8 ,run on VM.
cd /home
myPath='install_mxnet'
if [ -x "$myPath" ]; then 
rm -rf "$myPath" 
fi 
mkdir install_mxnet
cd install_mxnet
yum -y install git
if [ "$?" == "0"]; then
  echo "git install fail"
  exit 0
fi

######update gcc to 4.8.2,if you gcc version <4.8,you must update gcc first 
new_gcc='/opt/rh/devtoolset-2/root/usr/bin/gcc'
cd /etc/yum.repos.d
wget http://people.centos.org/tru/devtools-2/devtools-2.repo
yum -y install devtoolset-2-gcc devtoolset-2-binutils devtoolset-2-gcc-c++
if [ ! -f "$new_gcc" ]; then
  echo "gcc install fail"
  exit 0
fi
###centos 5.8 gcc version is 4.1.2, you should rename gcc.bakxxx, which depend  your gcc version
mv -f /usr/bin/gcc /usr/bin/gcc.bak4.1.2
mv -f /usr/bin/c++ /usr/bin/c++.bak4.1.2
mv -f /usr/bin/g++ /usr/bin/g++.bak4.1.2

ln -s /opt/rh/devtoolset-2/root/usr/bin/gcc /usr/bin/gcc
ln -s /opt/rh/devtoolset-2/root/usr/bin/c++ /usr/bin/c++
ln -s /opt/rh/devtoolset-2/root/usr/bin/g++ /usr/bin/g++
cd -

######atlas
libcblas='/usr/lib64/atlas/libcblas.so'
rpm -ivh http://mirrors.yun-idc.com/epel/5Server/x86_64/epel-release-5-4.noarch.rpm
yum -y install atlas-devel
if [ ! -f "$libcblas" ]; then
  echo "atlas install fail"
  exit 0
fi
ln -s /usr/lib64/atlas/libcblas.so /usr/lib/libcblas.so

######update python, if your python version <2.7, update python to 2.7 first
new_python='/usr/local/bin/python2.7'
yum -y groupinstall 'Development Tools'
yum -y install openssl-devel\* ncurses-devel\* zlib*.x86_64
yum -y install bzip2 bzip2-devel bzip2-libs

wget https://www.python.org/ftp/python/2.7.9/Python-2.7.9.tgz
tar -xzf Python-2.7.9.tgz
cd Python-2.7.9
./configure
make
make install
if [ ! -f "$new_python" ]; then
  echo "python update fail"
  exit 0
fi
mv /usr/bin/python /usr/bin/python2.4.3
ln -s /usr/local/bin/python2.7 /usr/bin/python
sed -i 's/#!\/usr\/bin\/python/#!\/usr\/bin\/python2.4.3/g'  /usr/bin/yum 
cd -

#######install setuptools
wget --no-check-certificate https://bootstrap.pypa.io/ez_setup.py
python ez_setup.py --insecure

######install numpy
wget http://sourceforge.net/projects/numpy/files/NumPy/1.10.2/numpy-1.10.2.tar.gz
if [ "$?" == "0" ];then
  echo "numpy download fail"
  exit 0
fi
tar -xzf numpy-1.10.2.tar.gz 
cd numpy-1.10.2
python setup.py build
python setup.py install
cd -

######install mxnet
git clone --recursive https://github.com/dmlc/mxnet
if [ "$?" == "0" ]; then
  echo "mxnet download fail"
  exit 0
fi
cd mxnet
cp make/config.mk .
sed -i 's/USE_OPENCV = 1/USE_OPENCV = 0/g' config.mk  
sed -i 's/USE_DIST_KVSTORE = 0/USE_DIST_KVSTORE = 1/g' config.mk
sed -i 's/wget/wget\ --no-check-certificate/g' ps-lite/make/deps.mk

## make -j4

have a try ~
